article_title: The Costs Of Medicaid Expansion Are Real And Often Much Larger Than Expected

article_metadata.description: As a result of Medicaid’s many problems, the decision facing states about whether to expand is not nearly as simple as former Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) Kathleen Sebelius suggested when she referred to states refusing to expand as “morally repugnant and economically stupid.” The decision to expand Medicaid, particularly in light of abundant evidence of how the program is failing, involves large costs. As evidenced by Arizona, expansion often costs a lot more than expected.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
